name: VLM are BACK! Fokker 50 flight experience, London City to Antwerp
description:

Date of Travel: NOVEMBER 2017
Airline: VLM
Flight #: VO102
Aircraft: FOKKER 50
Livery: VLM standard livery 
Route: LCY-ANR
Tail number: OO-VLI
Miles: 192
Airborne time: 0h51m
Notes: First time on VLM since 2009

Thanks for finding my video and pressing play! 

When I heard VLM had started up again having gone bust over a year ago, I knew I had to take the opportunity to fly with them again. I‚Äôve a soft spot for them, having first been impressed with them back in 2009 when I travelled with them on the Manchester to London City route. Plus, they operate Fokker 50s and there are very few opportunities to fly on them, particularly in Europe. 

VLM have restarted using a Slovenian certificate, and they‚Äôre now based in Maribor, Slovenia although the airline‚Äôs history is distinctly Belgian. London to Antwerp is their only route right now (Antwerp having been a former base of theirs), and it‚Äôs a business rather than a leisure route. 

As this is a business route with a lot of the tickets being bought on expenses, don‚Äôt expect very cheap tickets. Mine cost me ¬£109 single, which is expensive - but worth it to catch the unique experience of a quirky airline operating a beloved and rare aircraft. 

Enjoy the report. 

_____________________________________

Do you have any ideas for future trip reports? Something you've never seen on YouTube before? Why not suggest it to me in the comments? I read every single one! üëçüèª
